Articles.Content:
I know this hit me right in the feels....

![spirit.png](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/spirit.png)
Awwwwwww ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I've read that before.

Really sad. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Here, have some happy endings!

![499051-wall2.png](https://s3.amazonaws.com/media.screened.com/uploads/0/570/499051-wall2.png)

Or this one:

![VbKV9DF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/VbKV9DF.jpg)

EDIT: Just found this:

![comic080612.jpg](http://allthingsd.com/files/2012/08/comic080612.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-14T01:48:31Z" title="07/14/2015 01:48  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 14, 2015</time> by windows\_x\_seven**
Stahp it guys! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)
Meanwhile, Voyager 1 & 2 are thinking, "Check your privilege."
I've seen the first one a few times, never seen the other ones though!
Almost didn't click thread - thanks for the "save," Wx7 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Almost didn't click thread - thanks for the "save," Wx7 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

is gud

Aw, I was hit.

An alternative rescue I drew yesterday...

[![120921SpiritDay8006.jpg](http://img11.hostingpics.net/pics/120921SpiritDay8006.jpg)](http://www.hostingpics.net/viewer.php?id=120921SpiritDay8006.jpg)

Maybe not relevant enough. Dunno. 

![7C2GfIF.gif](http://i.imgur.com/7C2GfIF.gif)

When I anthropomorphize devices, I always make them love doing what they were built to do. In my mind, Spirit would never even consider going home. He was totally jazzed every day that his mission could continue.

> 
> Aw, I was hit.
> An alternative rescue I drew yesterday...

You should have drawn kerbals.

> You should have drawn kerbals.

They would've broken it within 5 minutes.

> 
> When I anthropomorphize devices, I always make them love doing what they were built to do. In my mind, Spirit would never even consider going home. He was totally jazzed every day that his mission could continue.

Maaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaarrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrssssssssssssssssssssss!!!!

> 
> Maybe not relevant enough. Dunno. 
> [http://i.imgur.com/7C2GfIF.gif](http://i.imgur.com/7C2GfIF.gif)

Wait, do Pluto's moons like, not like him or something? Do his moons isolate or bully him?

> 
> Bwahahaha! DWARF PLANET, AHAHAHAHA

> 
> A DWARF DOG, AHAHAHA

> 
> YO PLUTO, MICKEY MOUSE CALLED, HE SAID HE WANTS HIS DOG BACK

> 
> HEY PLUTO, AREN'T RED DWARFS SUPPOSED TO BE BIG?

> 
> WHAT'S THAT HEART FOR? ARE YOU TRYING TO DATE CERES? HAHAHA

> 
> DWARF PLANET! DWARF PLANET! DWARF PLANET!

> 
> Or this one:
> 
> ![VbKV9DF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/VbKV9DF.jpg)

- Pulls up calculator - So that means:

Third last panel (all alone): January 22, 2010

Second last panel (first human visitors): March 17, 2044

Last panel (in the dome): June 5, 2102

Kinda realistic timing, surprisingly.

> 
> When I anthropomorphize devices,

You really should not do that - they hate it.

Or this one.

![opportunity.png](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/opportunity.png)
I suddenly want to cuddle with the Spirit rover. Maybe take it out to the auto shop and let it pick out it's favorite oil. I'm conflicted.

> 
> Wait, do Pluto's moons like, not like him or something? Do his moons isolate or bully him?

I can't even. XD

> 
> Wait, do Pluto's moons like, not like him or something? Do his moons isolate or bully him?

In moon years, they're in their teens now. They vanish for months at a time, never call, not even on holidays. They're also mad at him for not picking a tighter orbit. The Kuiper Belt is no place to raise your kids. In fact, it's cold as Hell.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-17T05:06:56Z" title="07/17/2015 05:06  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 17, 2015</time> by vger**

> 
> In fact, it's **cold** as **Hell**.

Oh the irony. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

Every time I see that XKCD about the rover I think about Ikea.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I07xDdFMdgw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

; ) ; ) ; ) cute especially the day 35k one 

![220px-Laika_ac_Laika_(6982605741).jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Laika_ac_Laika_(6982605741).jpg/220px-Laika_ac_Laika_(6982605741).jpg)

that what each of them desserve on each new planet we put our foots on definitely the bare minimum we could do whenever the time come ; )

" On April 11, 2008, Russian officials unveiled a monument to Laika. A small monument in her honour was built near the military research facility in Moscow which prepared Laika's flight to space. It features a dog standing on top of a rocket.[2][3] She also appears on the Monument to the Conquerors of Space in Moscow.[4]"

&

"Laika is memorialized in the form of a statue and plaque at **Star City**, Russia, the Russian Cosmonaut training facility.[29]"

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animals_in_space](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animals_in_space)

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_City,_Russia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_City,_Russia)

A small monument in her honour was built near the military research facility in Moscow which prepared Laika's flight to space. It features a dog standing on top of a rocket.[2'][3] She also appears on the Monument to the Conquerors of Space in Moscow.[4]"

Sorry to burst your bubble, but:

> 
> Officially, the area was known as "closed military townlet No. 1"

> 
> Star City is officially described as Ã¢â‚¬Å“closed military townlet No. 1Ã¢â‚¬Â: admission is 
> only granted to those given security clearance.

Star City's just the colloquial name; it isn't the name on the official books. People have submitted a proposal to re-name it "Star City" in late 2009, but as of 2011 it hasn't been approved.
